alert.note: Alert for Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 09 at 1:35AM PST until March 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...North winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
